definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Don’t forget God always keeps an alternative door open for every one.
sentences.chinese: 別忘了，上蒼隨時都在爲我們準備着另一扇門。

sentences.english: Some even seem to have an incredible appreciation for everyday they have left.
sentences.chinese: 更有甚者，他們天天爲仍然擁有這一天而感謝上蒼。

sentences.english: As long last love has arrived. And I thanks God that I am alive.
sentences.chinese: 一旦尋到最後的真愛，我會感謝上蒼讓我還活著。

sentences.english: For the past 18 years I have begged for your forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 十八年來，朕一直在祈求上蒼的寬恕。

sentences.english: The seeming punishment of winter is providing, in reality, invaluable aid.
sentences.chinese: 風霜雪凍看似上蒼的懲罰，而實際卻爲生命注入洪福。

sentences.english: Starbuck sees it as a gloomy religious warning.
sentences.chinese: 斯達巴克把它看作是冥冥上蒼的一個陰森森的警告。

sentences.english: God gave you a gift of 86,400 seconds today.
sentences.chinese: 上蒼給你一件禮物，就是今天有八萬六千四百秒。

sentences.english: Meg thanked God for a neighbor as forgiving as He was.
sentences.chinese: 梅格感激上蒼將如此寬宏大度的鄰居賜給了她。

sentences.english: Then I pray, thanking God for another day.
sentences.chinese: 然後，我開始祈禱，感謝上蒼給了我新的一天。

sentences.english: And it teaches us to rely more on the fellowship of others and on strength from God.
sentences.chinese: 並且它幫教我們更多依賴團體中的他人與上蒼的力量。

sentences.english: Many Chinese believe it is the gods who grant good fortune and opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 許多中國人相信福祿乃是上蒼所賜。

sentences.english: Fists high above his head, Lim shouted his victory to heaven.
sentences.chinese: 林奮高舉起拳頭，向着上蒼吼出他的勝利。
